```{r environment}
library(ggplot2)
library(gridExtra)
```

In this exercise we sample 100 data points form a log normal distribution with meanlog = 1, and sdlog = .25. We plot the data.
```{r sample}
set.seed(42)
data = data.frame(x = rlnorm(100, 1, .25))
plt1 = ggplot(data, aes(x=x)) + geom_histogram()
plt2 = ggplot(data, aes(x=x)) + geom_histogram() + scale_x_log10()
grid.arrange(plt1,plt2, nrow = 1)

data_mean = mean(data$x)
data_mean_log = mean(log(data$x))
data_var = var(data$x)
data_var_log = var(log(data$x))

```

The sample log mean is `r data_mean_log` and the sample sdlog is `r data_var_log`.
